item.title: Elon Musk’s X could still face sanctions for training Grok on Europeans’ data
item.description:
Earlier this week, the EU’s lead privacy regulator ended its court proceeding related to how X processed user data to train its Grok AI chatbot, but the saga isn’t over yet for the Elon Musk-owned social media platform formerly known as Twitter. The Irish Data Protection Commission (DPC) has confirmed to TechCrunch that it’s received […]

item.title: US researchers turn mice's skin transparent using common food dye - Interesting Engineering
item.description:
1. US researchers turn mice's skin transparent using common food dye  Interesting Engineering
  2. Scientists use food dye found in Doritos to make see-through mice  The Washington Post
  3. Common food dye found to make skin and muscle temporarily transparent | Medical research  The Guardian
  4. In a first, living mice are made transparent  STAT
  5. E-number found in Doritos can turn skin invisible, scientists find  The Telegraph

item.title: Kobo's first crack at a color e-reader should have Amazon worried
item.description: I spent two-and-a-half months using the Kobo Libra Colour to read books and articles — and I think it's the best color e-reader on the market.

item.title: iPhone 16 'Desert Titanium': Leakers can't seem to agree on whether it's dark gold, bronze, or beige
item.description: The iPhone 16 Pro models are reportedly coming in a Desert Titanium color, but leakers can't seem to agree on which hue it is.

item.title: A Mercury-bound probe just provided a spectacular sneak preview of its mission
item.description: The BepiColombo spacecraft, a joint European and Japanese mission, has rebounded from a propulsion glitch this spring for its fourth Mercury flyby.

item.title: The 4 best robot vacuums for carpet and rugs in 2024
item.description: We're continuously testing and comparing top vacs from Roborock, iRobot, and more to find the best robot vacuums for lifting pet hair and crumbs from carpets.
